review_title: Poor pay, poor benefits, hostile administration
pros: There's no corporate micromanaging. People in leadership are nurses and not business major desk jockeys. Shift differentials are nice because they are percentage based and not a flat rate.
cons: They lack resources other hospitals in the area like and IV team. The health insurance is terrible. You will pay a lot out of poclet. When I worked for sentara, you received a 20% employee discount and the coverage was great. I'd pay less than $20 for routine annual labs. Those same labs cost $200 when I worked with Augusta and they offer no employee discounts at their facilities. Sentara accrues vacation time based on how much you work. Augusta is a fixed rate and you get an additional day after 5 years with the company. Sentara recently also started offering several weeks of parrntal leave as well as offering reimbursement for adoption and fertility expenses. Sentara also pays experience nurses almost $20/hr more base pay for experienced nurses. The benefits and pay need a significant overhaul if they wish to be competitive especially since the hospital brags that it's the only one in the area with no debt. The administration has had several formal complaints of bullying, hostility, and retaliation with no resolution from HR. Only half hearted apologies at best. It's easier for them to get away with it because it's a small hospital and they don't have corporate overlords to answer to. In short, the benefits are lacking, pay is not competitive, and the work environment is hostile if you step out of line.

pros: Great family feeling and community hospital. Recent wage increases.
cons: Grew too fast, and now is catching up in all areas. And sometimes the "family" feeling gets in the way of what this hospital needs - looking to the future. The past is in the past, so keep it there. Focus on the future and how to adjust Augusta to be better in management and keeping employees. Ideas are not taken seriously or welcomed.

pros: Flexible co-workers and managers who work with you to grow and strive. Opportunities for growth, learning, and leadership.
cons: I personally dislike the Monday-Friday job style.

review_title: fun place to work at for those who love working with people
